New Records: Emmanuel Clase tied Cody Allen with 149 career saves on Cleveland's all-time list.
Emmanuel Clase has converted a career-high 26 straight save opportunities since May 20.
Cleveland's six hits in the seventh inning marked a season high for a single inning.
Vinnie Pasquantino collected a career-high four hits.
Key Match Events: Bo Naylor sparked a rally in the seventh inning with his 11th home run.
Hunter Gaddis worked a 1-2-3 eighth inning.
Emmanuel Clase secured his 39th save by mowing through the top of the Royals lineup.
Josh Naylor, Will Brennan, and Jhonkensy Noel contributed key hits in the seventh inning rally.
Michael Massey hit his first career leadoff home run.
Vinnie Pasquantino hit his 19th home run.
Michael Massey and Bobby Witt Jr. added solo home runs for the Royals.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised the team's resilience and ability to come back in the game.
Tanner Bibee reflected on the importance of executing pitches and the team's fighting spirit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland avoided a four-game sweep and maintained first place in the AL Central Division.
The Guardians moved one game ahead of Kansas City for sole possession of first place in the division with 28 games remaining.
The two clubs will meet again on Monday for a three-game set at Kauffman Stadium.
